metadata.Title: CVE-2017-12166 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
OpenVPN versions before 2.3.3 and 2.4.x before 2.4.4 are vulnerable to a buffer overflow vulnerability when key-method 1 is used, possibly resulting in code execution. sbeattie> vulnerable only in configurations that have 'key method 1â€™ set.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-12166` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

openvpn - 2.4.4-2ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openvpn package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.4.4-2ubuntu1').
